column4: ok im stumped at phase 1, i want to create a test page but I cant write to /var/www can someone help me pls
you should put your web files into your users site folder? not /var/www/
but i don't know what you have set up
just installed apache,mysql and php with all its default settings
ok, so where do you point your browser to look at your webserver root?
the pages that are pulled up be default are located under var/www/apache2-default but I have no access there
do a search for "index.html.nl" that should reside in the directory you are looking for.    try #apache?
that page is also under var/www/apache2-default
there's gotta be an apache config file somewhere there :)
if you search in httpd.conf there's a section called DocumentRoot, that should show you the path to your web served directory
you found a file called httpd.conf? and it was empty?
you can create a php file with this in it: <?php phpinfo() ?>
